page.title: 02FISHING
page.content: Peterhead is the largest white fish port in Europe.In summer the main type of fish caught are demersal.These feed on the bottom of the sea.These fish are caught by dragging a net along the seabed.The main places where Peterhead fishermen go to fish are the Flugga grounds near Shetland,East_west of the Fair Isle and North_north_west of the Pentland Firth.After five and a half months the boat switches to pelagic gear i.e. for fish that swim near the sea's surface.They then fish for herring for 6_8 weeks.Once this period has passed they start fishing for mackarel at the Minches on the West Coast of Scotland.
